Description: b - Two fragments of ragged medium-coarse quality linen cloth, with a high prepderence of warp threads, possibly coloured with yellow ochre; one plain selvedge, other edges torn and ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.26 ends per 10mm and weft c.6-7 picks per 10mm. c - Short length from a torn stip of undyed, medium-fine quality linen cloth. Edges torn or ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun (and NOT S-spliced); the stitch gauge is warp c.40 ends per 10mm and weft c.16-17 picks per 10mm. d - Six torn strips of medium quality linen mummy-wrapping dyed with tannin(?). Vertical edges torn, transverse edges ragged. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun (and NOT) S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.31-32 ends per 10mm and weft c.12picks per 10mm. e - Three ragged fragments of medium-fine quality linen cloth dyed with tannin(?). Edges ragged or torn. One main fragment, and two very fragile others. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun (and NOT S-spliced); the stitch gauge is warp c.44 ends per 10mm and weft c.12-13 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: B is possibly the same cloth as BM 6556 and BM 6558. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
